Technique: ROUGH-HEWN; DRAWING; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Draft of thanksgiving to Meretseger
Description: This ostracon bears a draft of an ex-voto for Meretseger, lady of the West. The cobra goddess raises herself on a socle, wearing a head-dress consisting of horns and the solar disk. In front of her a vase is found, which contains four round breads and two blue lotus. Above the scene, one notices several hieroglyphic signs noting the name and the title of the goddess. The reverse also bears an inscription in hieroglyphs.
